titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Poynter Fellowship in Journalism, Yale University, Records
Poynter Fellowship in Journalism, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:11

did.unittitle: Poynter Fellowship in Journalism, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of administrative files, audiotapes, and videotapes documenting recipients of the Poynter Fellowship in Journalism at Yale University. Recipients include Steven Brill, David Gergen, and Charlayne Hunter-Gault. Also includes an audiotape of the R. Woodward Fellowship lecture, 1994.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of the Secretary

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 4-A (YRG 4-A), Records of the Yale secretary's office.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Poynter Fellowship in Journalism, Yale University, Records (RU 228). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of administrative files, audiotapes, and videotapes documenting recipients of the Poynter Fellowship in Journalism at Yale University. Recipients include Steven Brill, David Gergen, and Charlayne Hunter-Gault. Also includes an audiotape of the R. Woodward Fellowship lecture, 1994.
